1.question_text: The Smalltown Senior Center will host its annual Crafts Fair at the center on December 13 from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M.
This event is held in high regard by the community.
All of the best artists and craftspeople of Smalltown are represented each year.
As in years past, we will be providing booth space for rental.
A five-foot table costs $50, and a U-shaped six-by-six-by-six booth costs $125.
To reserve your space, please call Helen Dwyer at (555) 579-1343.
We expect to sell out all available spaces soon, so do not miss your chance to participate.
ll the proceeds from booth rentals go to support our activities at the center.
We look forward to hearing from you.

2.question_text: We are really grateful to all of you who have signed up for the 10th Rosydale City Marathon that was scheduled for this coming Saturday at 10 a.m. .
Unfortunately, as you may already know, the weather forecast says that there is going to be a downpour throughout the race day.
We truly hoped that the race would go smoothly.
However, it is likely that the heavy rain will make the roads too slippery and dangerous for the racers to run safely.
As a result, we have decided to cancel the race.
We hope you understand and we promise to hold another race in the near future.

3.question_text: It was Valentine’s Day on Friday and Peter was certain that his wife, Amy, was going to love his surprise.
Peter had spent a long time searching online for an event that would be a new way to spend time with Amy.
He had finally found the perfect thing for her.
She often told him that she liked to go to places she had never visited before, and he was absolutely sure that she would love going to the new, five-star restaurant downtown.
He smiled as he called the restaurant and asked for a reservation for Friday.
Unfortunately, his smile quickly disappeared when he was told that the restaurant was fully reserved.
“I thought that I had found the right place.”

4.question_text: We almost universally accept that playing video games is at best a pleasant break from a student’s learning and more often what prevents a student from accomplishing their goals.
Games catch and hold attention in a way that few things can.
And yet once they have our focus, they rarely seem to offer anything meaningful to help students grow in their lives outside the games.
While this may be true for many games, we are too easily ignoring a valuable tool that could be used to enhance productivity instead of derailing it.
Rather, it is desirable that we develop games that connect to the learning outcomes we want for our students.
This will enable educators to take advantage of games’ attention commanding capacities and allow our students to enjoy their games while learning.

5.question_text: The position of the architect rose during the Roman Empire, as architecture symbolically became a particularly important political statement.
Cicero classed the architect with the physician and the teacher, and Vitruvius spoke of 'so great a profession as this.'

Marcus Vitruvius Pollio, a practicing architect during the rule of Augustus Caesar, recognized that architecture requires both practical and theoretical knowledge, and he listed the disciplines he felt the aspiring architect should master: literature and writing, draftsmanship, mathematics, history, philosophy, music, medicine, law, and astronomy ― a curriculum that still has much to recommend it.

All of this study was necessary, he argued, because architects who have aimed at acquiring manual skill without scholarship have never been able to reach a position of authority to correspond to their plans, while those who have relied only upon theories and scholarship were obviously 'hunting the shadow, not the substance.'

6.question_text: The ability to understand emotions ― to have a diverse emotion vocabulary and to understand the causes and consequences of emotion ― is particularly relevant in group settings.
Individuals who are skilled in this domain are able to express emotions, feelings and moods accurately and thus, may facilitate clear communication between co-workers.
Furthermore, they may be more likely to act in ways that accommodate their own needs as well as the needs of others (i.e. cooperate).
In a group conflict situation, for example, a member with a strong ability to understand emotion will be able to express how he feels about the problem and why he feels this way.
He also should be able to take the perspective of the other group members and understand why they are reacting in a certain manner.
Appreciation of differences creates an arena for open communication and promotes constructive conflict resolution and improved group functioning.

7.question_text: The arrival of the Industrial Age changed the relationship among time, labor, and capital.
Factories could produce around the clock, and they could do so with greater speed and volume than ever before.

A machine that runs twelve hours a day will produce more widgets than one that runs for only eight hours per day ― and a machine that runs twenty-four hours per day will produce the most widgets of all.
As such, at many factories, the workday is divided into eight-hour shifts, so that there will always be people on hand to keep the widget machines humming.

Industrialization raised the potential value of every single work hour ― the more hours you worked, the more widgets you produced, and the more money you made ― and thus wages became tied to effort and production.
Labor, previously guided by harvest cycles, became clock-oriented, and society started to reorganize around new principles of productivity.

8.question_text: The selfie resonates not because it is new, but because it expresses, develops, expands, and intensifies the long history of the self-portrait.
The self-portrait showed to others the status of the person depicted.
In this sense, what we have come to call our own 'image' ― the interface of the way we think we look and the way others see us ― is the first and fundamental object of global visual culture.
The selfie depicts the drama of our own daily performance of ourselves in tension with our inner emotions that may or may not be expressed as we wish.
At each stage of the self-portrait's expansion, more and more people have been able to depict themselves.
Today's young, urban, networked majority has reworked the history of the self-portrait to make the selfie into the first visual signature of the new era.

9.question_text: The graph above shows the percentages of women employed behind the scenes on the top 100 U.S. films by role in 2020, 2021, and 2022.
For each of the three years, the percentage of women employed as producers on the top 100 U.S. films was the highest as compared with the percentages of each of the other three roles.
The percentage of women employed as directors on the top 100 U.S. films in 2021 was lower than in 2020 but higher than in 2022.
The percentage of women employed as writers on the top 100 U.S. films increased by 4 percentage points from 2020 to 2021 and by 1 percentage point from 2021 to 2022.
The percentage of women employed as editors on the top 100 U.S. films was less than 20% in each of the three years.
In 2022, the percentage of women employed as producers on the top 100 U.S. films was the same as that in 2020.

10.question_text: Dick Enberg was one of America’s most beloved sports broadcasters.
He was born in Michigan in 1935. In the early 1960s, he became an assistant professor at San Fernando Valley State College, where he also served as a coach of its baseball team.
Afterwards, he began a full-time sportscasting career in Los Angeles.
The percentage of women employed as writers on the top 100 U.S. films increased by 4 percentage points from 2020 to 2021 and by 1 percentage point from 2021 to 2022.
In 1973, he became the first U.S.sportscaster ever to visit China.
He joined NBC Sports in 1975 and remained with the network for about 25 years covering such big events as the Olympics.
He later worked for other major sports broadcasting stations.
He made his last live broadcast in 2016 and died the following year at the age of 82.
He served as Chairman of the American Sportscaster Association for more than three decades.
Enberg was also a best-selling writer and won Emmy Awards as a sportscaster, a writer, and a producer.

11.question_text: The Adenville City Pass Card is a public transportation card for tourists visiting Adenville.
Service Range : ∙Adenville-based subway lines ∙Adenville-licensed buses ※ This card cannot be used for city tour buses.
1-Day Card: The price is $10, 3-Day Card: The price is $25. 5-Day Card: The price is $40.Additional Benefit :10% off admission for major tourist attractions
Unused cards are refundable within 30 days of the purchase date.
Purchase Information ∙Physical cards can be purchased at subway stations. ∙Mobile cards can be purchased on the A-Transit app.

12.question_text: Luckwood Snow Festival. We’re happy to announce the 15th annual Luckwood Snow Festival. Come to the festival to enjoy winter activities and enjoy activities. [announce: 알리다, annual: 해마다의, festival: 축제, enjoy: 즐기다, activities: 활동]
When & Where ∙January 24th—30th (7 days), from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. ∙Luckwood Park [a.m.: 오전, p.m.: 오후]

Special Activities ∙Snow Sculpture Contest: 11 teams will participate. ∙Fun in the Snow: Kids can enjoy snow tunnels and snow slides and participate snow slides. [sculpture: 조각, contest: 대회, participate: 참가하다, tunnel: 터널, slides: 미끄럼틀]

Transportation ∙Parking is not available (Use public transportation and/or shuttle bus service). ∙The shuttle bus runs between Luckwood Subway Station and Luckwood Park (One-way fare: $1, cash only). [transportation: 교통, available: 이용 가능한, public transportation: 대중교통, shuttle bus: 셔틀버스, runs: 운행하다, between: 사이를, one-way: 편도의, fare: 요금, cash: 현금, only: 오직]
※ For more information, please visit www.ldsnow.org. [information: 정보, visit: 방문하다]

13.question_text: Think of yourself. When you decide to get up and get a drink of water, for example, you don’t consciously organize or consider the host of steps involved. [get up: 일어나다, drink: 마시다, water: 물, steps: 단계, consciously: 의식적으로, organize: 정리하다, consider: 고려하다, host of: 많은, involved: 관련된]

Imagine if we had to consider every single muscle that needed to be contracted or relaxed just to stand up and walk. [imagine: 상상하다, every: 모든, single: 단 하나의, muscle: 근육, contracted: 수축된, relaxed: 이완된, stand up: 일어서다, walk: 걷다, just: 단지]

It would be tiresome and very slow ― as patients recovering from a brain injury affecting the motor system knows. [tiresome: 지루한, slow: 느린, patients: 환자, recovering: 회복 중인, brain: 뇌, injury: 부상, affecting: 영향을 주는, motor system: 운동 체계, knows: 알고 있다]

The autopilot parts of our brain do it for us automatically, freeing up our conscious mind for more important jobs. [autopilot: 자동 조종, parts: 부분, do: 하다, automatically: 자동으로, freeing up: 확보하다, conscious: 의식적인, mind: 마음, important: 중요한, jobs: 일]

It is the older parts of our brain that support these automatic processes that allow us to move, hear, see, and use many of our social skills. [older: 더 오래된, parts: 부분, support: 지원하다, automatic: 자동의, processes: 과정, allow: 허락하다, move: 움직이다, hear: 듣다, see: 보다, use: 사용하다, social skills: 사회적 기술]

More recently evolved abilities like talking, reading, and writing are far less automated. [more: 더, recently: 최근에, evolved: 발전한, abilities: 능력, talking: 말하기, reading: 읽기, writing: 쓰기, far less: 훨씬 덜, automated: 자동화된]

So, most of the time, what you are perceiving, feeling, or thinking is based on a very crude and fast analysis that happens completely without your awareness. [most: 대부분, time: 시간, perceiving: 인지하는, feeling: 느끼는, thinking: 생각하는, based on: ~에 근거한, crude: 대략적인, fast: 빠른, analysis: 분석, completely: 완전히, awareness: 의식]

14.question_text: Studies in psychology have reported cases in which competitive incentives resulted in lower task effort, and their focus was on the psychological underpinnings of the reduction in motivation. [studies: 연구, psychology: 심리학, reported: 보고했다, cases: 사례, competitive: 경쟁적인, incentives: 동기, resulted in: ~의 결과가 되다, lower: 낮은, task: 과제, effort: 노력, focus: 초점, underpinnings: 근거, reduction: 감소, motivation: 동기]

For example, competition presents an inevitable conflict between the motivation to achieve one’s personal goal and the desire to maintain good relationships with others. [for example: 예를 들어, competition: 경쟁, presents: 보여주다/제시하다, inevitable: 불가피한, conflict: 갈등, motivation: 동기, achieve: 달성하다, personal: 개인의, goal: 목표, desire: 욕구, maintain: 유지하다, good relationships: 좋은 관계, others: 다른 사람들]

When the maintenance of interpersonal relationships is important, with their counterparts in particular or with others generally, competitors experience an internal conflict that can harm their desire to achieve their goal and taint the good feeling brought about by winning. [maintenance: 유지, interpersonal relationships: 대인관계, important: 중요한, counterparts: 상대, in particular: 특히, generally: 일반적으로, competitors: 경쟁자, experience: 경험하다, internal conflict: 내적 갈등, harm: 해치다, desire: 욕구, achieve: 달성하다, goal: 목표, taint: 해치다, good feeling: 좋은 기분, brought about: 초래된, winning: 승리]

Exline and Lobel found that the perception of oneself as a target for upward social comparison often makes people uncomfortable. [found: 발견했다, perception: 인식, oneself: 자신, target: 목표, upward: 위로 향하는, social comparison: 사회적 비교, often: 자주, makes: 만들다, uncomfortable: 불편한]

When they believe that others are making envious comparisons with them, people feel uneasiness, distress, or sorrow. [believe: 믿다, others: 다른 사람들, making: 하는, envious: 질투하는, comparisons: 비교, feel: 느끼다, uneasiness: 불안, distress: 고통, sorrow: 슬픔]

Feelings of guilt, an emotion generally associated with high motivation for goal-achievement, lead to stronger motivation and performance in the pursuit of competitive goals. [feelings: 감정, guilt: 죄책감, emotion: 감정, generally: 일반적으로, associated with: 관련된, high: 높은, motivation: 동기, goal-achievement: 목표 달성, lead to: ~로 이어지다, stronger: 더 강한, performance: 수행, pursuit: 추구, competitive goals: 경쟁 목표]

Consequences of this emotional state include lower task motivation in a competition and preferences for more cooperative and altruistic outcomes, such as diminishing the significance of the outcome or sharing the winner’s reward. [consequences: 결과, emotional state: 감정 상태, include: 포함하다, lower: 낮은, task: 과제, motivation: 동기, competition: 경쟁, preferences: 선호, cooperative: 협력적인, altruistic: 이타적인, outcomes: 결과, diminishing: 줄이는, significance: 중요성, outcome: 결과, sharing: 나누기, winner’s reward: 승자 보상]

15.question_text: The expansion of sports tourism in the twentieth century has been influenced by further developments in transportation. [expansion: 확장, sports tourism: 스포츠 관광, twentieth century: 20세기, influenced: 영향을 받다, further: 더, developments: 발전, transportation: 교통]

Just as the railways revolutionized travel in the nineteenth century, so the automobile produced even more dramatic changes in the twentieth. [just as: 마치 ~처럼, railways: 철도, revolutionized: 혁신을 일으켰다, travel: 여행, nineteenth century: 19세기, automobile: 자동차, produced: 만들어내다, dramatic: 극적인, changes: 변화, twentieth: 20세기]

The significance of the car in the development of sport and tourism generally has attracted considerable coverage and it has had no less an impact on sports tourism specifically. [significance: 중요성, car: 자동차, development: 발전, sport: 스포츠, tourism: 관광, generally: 일반적으로, attracted: 끌다, considerable: 상당한, coverage: 보도/주목, impact: 영향, specifically: 구체적으로]

Although originally invented towards the end of the nineteenth century, it started to become a mass form of transport in the 1920s in the USA and rather later in Britain. [originally: 원래, invented: 발명되다, towards: ~쪽으로, mass form: 대중적인 형태, transport: 교통수단, rather later: 다소 늦게, Britain: 영국]

Apart from its convenience and flexibility, the car has the additional advantages of affording access to many areas not served by public transport, as well as allowing the easy transport of luggage and equipment. [apart from: ~외에도, convenience: 편리함, flexibility: 융통성, additional: 추가적인, advantages: 장점, affording: 제공하다, access: 접근, areas: 지역, served: 제공되다, public transport: 대중교통, allowing: 허용하다, easy: 쉬운, luggage: 짐, equipment: 장비]

The expansion of reasonably priced, good quality accommodation associated with tourism growth has also facilitated the growth of locally based restaurants. [expansion: 확장, reasonably priced: 적당한 가격의, good quality: 좋은 품질, accommodation: 숙박시설, associated with: ~와 관련된, tourism growth: 관광 성장, facilitated: 용이하게 했다, locally based: 지역 기반의, restaurants: 식당]

As a result, it was invaluable for the development of many forms of sports tourism but especially those which require the transportation of people and equipment to relatively remote locations. [as a result: 결과적으로, invaluable: 매우 귀중한, development: 발전, forms: 형태, require: 필요로 하다, transportation: 운송, people: 사람, equipment: 장비, relatively: 비교적, remote: 먼, locations: 장소]

16.question_text: The potential for market enforcement is greater when contracting parties have developed reputational capital that can be devalued when contracts are violated. [potential: 잠재력, market enforcement: 시장 규제/집행, greater: 더 큰, contracting parties: 계약 당사자, developed: 개발된, reputational capital: 평판 자산, devalued: 가치가 떨어지다, contracts: 계약, violated: 위반되다]

Similarly, a landowner can undermaintain fences, ditches, and irrigation systems. Accurate assessments of farmer and landowner behavior will be made over time, and those farmers and landowners who attempt to gain at each other’s expense will find that others may refuse to deal with them in the future. [similarly: 마찬가지로, landowner: 토지 소유주, undermaintain: 충분히 관리하지 않다, fences: 울타리, ditches: 배수로, irrigation systems: 관개 시스템, accurate: 정확한, assessments: 평가, behavior: 행동, over time: 시간이 지나면서, attempt: 시도하다, gain: 얻다, at each other’s expense: 서로의 손해를 보면서, refuse: 거절하다, deal with: 거래하다]

Over time landowners indirectly monitor farmers by observing the reported output, the general quality of the soil, and any unusual or extreme behavior. [over time: 시간이 지나면서, landowners: 토지 소유주, indirectly: 간접적으로, monitor: 관찰하다, farmers: 농부, observing: 관찰하면서, reported output: 보고된 생산량, general quality: 일반적 품질, soil: 토양, unusual: 이상한, extreme: 극단적인, behavior: 행동]

Farmer and landowner reputations act as a bond. In any growing season a farmer can reduce effort, overuse soil, or underreport the crop. [reputations: 평판, act as: ~로 작용하다, bond: 유대/연결, growing season: 성장기, reduce: 줄이다, effort: 노력, overuse: 과도하게 사용하다, soil: 토양, underreport: 적게 보고하다, crop: 작물]

Farmers and landowners develop reputations for honesty, fairness, producing high yields, and consistently demonstrating that they are good at what they do. In small, close-knit farming communities, reputations are well known. [develop: 개발하다, reputations: 평판, honesty: 정직, fairness: 공정함, producing: 생산, high yields: 높은 수확량, consistently: 꾸준히, demonstrating: 보여주다, good at: ~을 잘하다, small: 작은, close-knit: 친밀한, farming communities: 농촌 공동체, well known: 잘 알려진]
